sn55.11:3.1: 11 A Saṅgha of a Thousand Nuns
sn55.11:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Royal Monastery.
sn55.11:4.2: Then a Saṅgha of a thousand nuns went up to the Buddha,
sn55.11:4.3: bowed, and stood to one side.
sn55.11:5.1: “Nuns, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.11:5.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.11:5.8: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones …
sn55.11:5.10: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
